statement.tex: %text Write the value of $(\hat i\times \hat j)\cdot \hat k+\hat i\cdot \hat j$ %

step.context: %text General question: In the context of this scalar triple product $(\hat i\times \hat j)\cdot \hat k$, are the following equivalent? %
step.tex: (\hat i\times \hat j)\cdot \hat k=(\hat i\cdot \hat j)\times \hat k
step.reason: %text $(\hat i\cdot \hat j)\times \hat k$ is not even a valid operation since the resulting term in the parenthesis is a scalar and it cannot be cross multiplied with a vector. The following though are equivalent: % (\hat i\times \hat j)\cdot \hat k=\hat i\cdot (\hat j\times \hat k) \\

step.context: %text What are $A$, $B$, $C$ and $D$ if $\hat i$, $\hat j$ and $\hat k$ are a set of mutually perpendicular unit vectors. % \begin{align} \hat i\cdot \hat k=A &\qquad \hat k\cdot \hat i=B \\ \hat i\times\hat j=C &\qquad \hat j\times \hat k=D \end{align}
step.tex: A=0, B=0, C=\hat k, D=\hat i
A=1, B=1, C=-\hat k, D=-\hat i
